Briana;ldsfaj;lsk Lee, Graduate Student
Research Assistant

Texas Materials Institute
The University of Texas at Austin

CV

I joined the University of Texas at Austin to pursue my PhD in Materials Science and Engineering where I am studying defect complexes using computational methods with Prof. Wennie Wang as my principal advisor

I obtained my BS in Chemistry from Texas A&M University in December 2021, where I researched under Prof. Lei Fang in the Department of Chemistry, working on superhydrophobic materials.

Upon graduating from Texas A&M, I worked as an organic chemist at American Biochemicals where we worked on custom organic synthesis, purification, and characterization.

Publication

Li, C.; Lee, B.; Wang, C.; Bajpayee, A.; Douglas, L. D.; Phillips, B. K.; Yu, G.; Rivera-Gonzalez, N.; Peng, B.; Jiang, Z.; Sue, H.-J.; Banerjee, S.; Fang, L. Photopolymerized Superhydrophobic Hybrid Coating Enabled by Dual-Purpose Tetrapodal ZnO for Liquid/Liquid Separation.. Materials Horizons, 2022,[https://doi.org/10.1039/d1mh01672e
